swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/ad.title: Advanced Topics
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/ad.description: Deep dive into advanced features and optimization techniques.

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/ad.title: research
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/ad.description: The automated market maker is a new concept, and as such, new research comes out frequently. We've selected some of the most thoughtful here.

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/ad.title: understanding-returns
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/ad.description: SwapX incentivizes users to add liquidity to trading pools by rewarding providers with the fees generated when other users trade with those pools. Market making, in general, is a complex activity. There is a risk of losing money during large and sustained movement in the underlying asset price compared to simply holding an asset.

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/co.title: flash-swaps
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/co.description: SwapX flash swaps¬†allow you to withdraw up to the full reserves of any ERC20 token on SwapX and execute arbitrary logic at no upfront cost, provided that by the end of the transaction you either:

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/co.title: Core Concepts
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/co.description: Essential concepts for understanding and working with SwapX V2.

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/pr.title: ecosystem-participants
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/pr.description: The SwapX ecosystem is primarily comprised of three types of users: liquidity providers, traders, and developers. Liquidity providers are incentivized to contribute ERC-20 tokens to common liquidity pools. Traders can swap these tokens for one another for a fixed 0.30% fee (which goes to liquidity providers). Developers can integrate directly with SwapX smart contracts to power new and exciting interactions with tokens, trading interfaces, retail experiences, and more.

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/pr.title: Protocol Overview
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/pr.description: High-level overview of the SwapX V2 protocol architecture and design principles.

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/pr.title: smart-contracts
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/pr.description: SwapX V2 is a binary smart contract system. Core contracts provide fundamental safety guarantees for all parties interacting with SwapX. Periphery contracts interact with one or more core contracts but are not themselves part of the core.

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/RE.title: üìñ Concepts
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/concepts/RE.description: Understanding the core concepts behind SwapX V2 protocol.

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/inte.title: Interface Integration
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/inte.description: Learn how to integrate SwapX V2 into your frontend application.

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/inte.title: using-the-api
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/inte.description: In this guide we will create a web interface that consumes and displays data from the SwapX Subgraph. The goal is to provide a quick overview of a setup that you can extend to create your own UIs and analytics around SwapX data.

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/READ.title: üìö Guides
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/READ.description: Step-by-step guides for integrating with SwapX V2 smart contracts.

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/smar.title: building-an-oracle
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/smar.description: To build a price oracle on SwapX V2, you must first understand the

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/smar.title: providing-liquidity
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/smar.description: When providing liquidity from a smart contract, the most important thing to keep in mind is that tokens deposited into a pool at any rate other than the current reserve ratio are vulnerable to being arbitraged. As an example, if the ratio of x2 (i.e. the price is 5), and someone naively adds liquidity at 51. To avoid donating to arbitrageurs, it is imperative to add liquidity at the current price. Luckily, it's easy to ensure that this condition is met!

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/smar.title: quick-start
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/smar.description: Developing smart contracts for Ethereum involves a variety of off-chain tools used for producing and testing bytecode

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/smar.title: Smart Contract Integration
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/smar.description: Build smart contracts that interact with SwapX V2 protocol.

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/smar.title: supporting-meta-transactions
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/smar.description: All SwapX V2 pool tokens support meta-transaction approvals via the permit function. This obviates the need for a blocking approve transaction before programmatic interactions with pool tokens can occur.

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/smar.title: trading-from-a-smart-contract
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/smar.description: When trading from a smart contract, the most important thing to keep in mind is that access to an external price source is required. Without this, trades can be frontrun for considerable loss.

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/smar.title: using-flash-swaps
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/guides/smar.description: Flash swaps are an integral feature of SwapX V2. In fact, under the hood, all swaps are actually flash swaps! This simply means that pair contracts send output tokens to the recipient before enforcing that enough input tokens have been received. This is slightly atypical, as one might expect a pair to ensure it's received payment before delivery. However, because Ethereum transactions are atomic, we can roll back the entire swap if it turns out that the contract hasn't received enough tokens to make itself whole by the end of the transaction.

swapx-developer/contracts-v2/README.title: ‚öôÔ∏è Contracts V2
swapx-developer/contracts-v2/README.description: Welcome to the SwapX protocol v2 docs.

swapx-developer/contracts-v3/guides/flas.title: Inheritance-constructors
swapx-developer/contracts-v3/guides/flas.description: In this guide, we will write a smart contract that calls flash on a V3 pool and swaps the full amount withdrawn of token0 and token1 in the corresponding pools with the same token pair - but different fee tiers. After the swap, the contract will pay back the first pool and transfer profits to the original calling address.

swapx-developer/contracts-v3/guides/prov.title: the-full-contract
swapx-developer/contracts-v3/guides/prov.description: Below we have the complete functioning code example: a contract that can custody SwapX V3 position NFT's and manipulate the positions and liquidity therein by collecting fees, increasing or decreasing liquidity, and minting new positions. View the source code.

swapx-developer/contracts-v3/reference/R.title: üìñ Reference
swapx-developer/contracts-v3/reference/R.description: Complete API reference for SwapX V3 smart contracts.

swapx-developer/quick-start-tutorial/con.title: Connecting to the Network
swapx-developer/quick-start-tutorial/con.description: SwapX operates on its own dedicated testnet chain. You must configure your application to connect to the correct RPC endpoint and use the correct Chain ID.

swapx-developer/quick-start-tutorial/env.title: Environment Setup
swapx-developer/quick-start-tutorial/env.description: Before you start building with SwapX, you need to set up your development environment.

swapx-developer/quick-start-tutorial/exe.title: Executing Trades
swapx-developer/quick-start-tutorial/exe.description: This guide covers how to construct a trade and send it to the blockchain.

swapx-developer/quick-start-tutorial/rea.title: Reading Chain Data
swapx-developer/quick-start-tutorial/rea.description: In this tutorial, we will learn how to fetch data from SwapX V2 pairs and V3 pools using the SDKs and ethers.

swapx-developer/quick-start-tutorial/REA.title: üöÄ Quick Start Tutorial
swapx-developer/quick-start-tutorial/REA.description: Get up and running with SwapX development quickly.

swapx-developer/README.title: üßë‚Äçüíª SwapX Developer
swapx-developer/README.description: Welcome to the SwapX v3 smart contracts documentation.

swapx-developer/sdks-core/README.title: üõ†Ô∏è SDKs Core
swapx-developer/sdks-core/README.description: Core SDK utilities and shared functionality for SwapX SDKs.

swapx-developer/sdks-core/reference/clas.title: Classes
swapx-developer/sdks-core/reference/clas.description: Class definitions for core SDK functionality.

swapx-developer/sdks-core/reference/enum.title: Enums
swapx-developer/sdks-core/reference/enum.description: Enumeration types used in the core SDK.

swapx-developer/sdks-core/reference/modu.title: modules
swapx-developer/sdks-core/reference/modu.description: This page documents the core type definitions and interfaces used throughout the SwapX SDK Core.

swapx-developer/sdks-core/reference/READ.title: README
swapx-developer/sdks-core/reference/READ.description: The SwapX SDK Core provides the foundational classes and utilities for working with the SwapX protocol. This package contains essential primitives like currencies, amounts, and mathematical utilities that are used across all SwapX SDK packages.

swapx-developer/sdks-v2/guides/quick-sta.title: quick-start
swapx-developer/sdks-v2/guides/quick-sta.description: The SwapX SDK exists to help developers build on top of SwapX. It's designed to run in any environment that can execute JavaScript (think websites, node scripts, etc.). While simple enough to use in a hackathon project, it's also robust enough to power production applications.

swapx-developer/sdks-v2/guides/README.title: üìö Guides
swapx-developer/sdks-v2/guides/README.description: Learn how to use the SwapX V2 SDK.

swapx-developer/sdks-v2/README.title: üõ†Ô∏è SDKs V2
swapx-developer/sdks-v2/README.description: JavaScript/TypeScript SDK for interacting with SwapX V2.

swapx-developer/sdks-v2/reference/gettin.title: getting-started
swapx-developer/sdks-v2/reference/gettin.description: The pages that follow contain technical reference information on the SwapX SDK.

swapx-developer/sdks-v2/reference/other-.title: other-exports
swapx-developer/sdks-v2/reference/other-.description: A enum denominating supported rounding options.

swapx-developer/sdks-v2/reference/pair.title: pair
swapx-developer/sdks-v2/reference/pair.description: The Pair entity represents a SwapX pair with a balance of each of its pair tokens.

swapx-developer/sdks-v2/reference/README.title: üìñ Reference
swapx-developer/sdks-v2/reference/README.description: Complete API reference for SwapX V2 SDK.

swapx-developer/sdks-v2/reference/route.title: route
swapx-developer/sdks-v2/reference/route.description: The Route entity represents one or more ordered SwapX pairs with a fully specified path from input token to output token.

swapx-developer/sdks-v2/reference/trade.title: trade
swapx-developer/sdks-v2/reference/trade.description: The Trade entity represents a fully specified trade along a route. This entity supplies all the information necessary to craft a router transaction.

swapx-developer/sdks-v3/guides/advanced/.title: introduction
swapx-developer/sdks-v3/guides/advanced/.description: For some more advanced use cases, it is necessary to use multiple tools in the SwapX toolchain.

swapx-developer/sdks-v3/guides/backgroun.title: background
swapx-developer/sdks-v3/guides/backgroun.description: Before integrating with SwapX, it may be helpful for newcomers to review the following background information on some important developer web3 concepts, the structure of our examples, and SDK concepts.

swapx-developer/sdks-v3/guides/liquidity.title: üíß Liquidity
swapx-developer/sdks-v3/guides/liquidity.description: Manage liquidity positions with the V3 SDK.

swapx-developer/sdks-v3/guides/README.title: üìö Guides
swapx-developer/sdks-v3/guides/README.description: Comprehensive guides for using SwapX V3 SDK.

swapx-developer/sdks-v3/guides/swaps/REA.title: üîÑ Swaps
swapx-developer/sdks-v3/guides/swaps/REA.description: Execute token swaps using the V3 SDK.

swapx-developer/sdks-v3/README.title: üõ†Ô∏è SDKs V3
swapx-developer/sdks-v3/README.description: JavaScript/TypeScript SDK for SwapX V3 with concentrated liquidity support.

swapx-developer/troubleshooting/sdk-erro.title: SDK Errors
swapx-developer/troubleshooting/sdk-erro.description: Common errors encountered when using the SwapX SDKs.

swapx-developer/troubleshooting/transact.title: Transaction Reverts
swapx-developer/troubleshooting/transact.description: When a transaction fails on the blockchain, it often provides a revert reason. Here are common ones in SwapX.

swapx-developer/use-case-example/liquidi.title: V3 Liquidity
swapx-developer/use-case-example/liquidi.description: V3 Liquidity is represented by Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs) rather than ERC20s. You select a specific price range.

swapx-developer/use-case-example/swappin.title: V2 Swaps
swapx-developer/use-case-example/swappin.description: SwapX V2 is based on the constant product formula $x * y = k$. It is simpler than V3 and uses standard ERC20 pairs.

swapx-developer/use-case-example/swappin.title: V3 Swaps
swapx-developer/use-case-example/swappin.description: SwapX V3 introduces concentrated liquidity, allowing for more capital-efficient trades but adding complexity to the swap logic (e.g., fee tiers).

swapx-integration/bridging/learn-more.title: üìñLearn more
swapx-integration/bridging/learn-more.description: A cross-chain bridge system based on Xone Chain is dedicated to breaking down barriers between chains, allowing assets to flow freely and securely between different blockchains.
